questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way for an IS auditor to determine how well an information security program has been implemented throughout the organization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The best way for an IS auditor to determine how well an information security program has been implemented throughout the organization is to perform security risk assessments for the organizationâ€™s business units.

Selected Answer: D
C will identify specific vulnerabilities and risks but does not assess the overall implementation of the security program like D.

Selected Answer: D
While evaluating the percentage of employees who have taken security awareness training (Option A) can provide some insight into the level of awareness within the organization, it does not necessarily reflect the effectiveness of the security program's implementation. On the other hand, evaluating the integration of security best practices into business workflow (Option D) provides a more comprehensive assessment of how well the security program has been integrated into everyday operations. This approach examines whether security measures are effectively applied in the organization's processes, procedures, and systems, indicating a more robust implementation of the security program.

Selected Answer: C
perform security risk assessments

Selected Answer: D
C. Perform security risk assessments for the organization's business units: This is a valuable practice, but it focuses on identifying potential vulnerabilities, not necessarily the effectiveness of the implemented program in mitigating those risks.
D. Evaluate the integration of security best practices into business workflow.

choices.D: Evaluate the integration of security best practices into business workflow.
choices.A: Evaluate the percentage of employees who have taken security awareness training.
choices.B: Review security awareness training content for completeness.
choices.C: Perform security risk assessments for the organization's business units.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important feature of access control software?

choices.C: Controls may not be assessed objectively.
choices.A: Employees may have insufficient awareness of controls.
choices.B: The assessment may not provide sufficient assurance to stakeholders.
choices.D: Communication between operational management and senior management may not be effective.

discussion.content: B. The assessment may not provide sufficient assurance to stakeholders.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the GREATEST concern associated with control self-assessments (CSAs)?

discussion.content: D. Business stakeholders are involved in approving the IT strategy.

Selected Answer: D
While communication of IT strategies to stakeholders (option A) is important for transparency and understanding, direct involvement of business stakeholders in approving the IT strategy (option D) ensures a higher degree of alignment between IT and organizational goals and objectives. Therefore, option D is the BEST demonstration of alignment between IT strategy and organizational goals.

Selected Answer: D
D) is the answer. The keyword here is "approving" which is more powerful then "communicated"

Selected Answer: D
The alignment between IT strategy and organizational goals and objectives is essential for ensuring that IT investments are appropriately aligned with the business needs of the organization. This alignment helps ensure that IT resources are utilized optimally, and IT projects deliver value to the organization.

Among the given options, the best demonstration that IT strategy is aligned with organizational goals and objectives is when business stakeholders are involved in approving the IT strategy

D. Business stakeholders are involved in approving the IT strategy. This ensures that the IT strategy is designed and implemented in a way that supports the organization's overall goals and objectives. When business stakeholders are involved in the approval process, there is a greater likelihood that the IT strategy will be aligned with the needs of the organization.
B should be right answer. Business Stakeholders do not get involved in approving the Strategy. CIO approves the Strategy because CIO is responsible for aligning the business strategy with IT strategy
I think B is the correct answer, because the IT strategy has to be built based on the business strategy.
